DataElement.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Histology Confirmed Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has had the study malignant neoplasm, a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, confirmed histologically, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains, as criteria to determine eligibility of a person for participation on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Malignant Neoplasm Histology Confirmed Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having the study malignant neoplasm, a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, confirmed histologically, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains, as criteria to determine eligibility of a person for participation on a clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Histology Confirmed Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the patient being entered
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient being entered within eight weeks of confirmation of disease diagnosis by surgery, biopsy, FNA or paracentesis or within eight weeks of primary or staging surgery if patient received primary surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient undergo definitive surgery for primary stage I-IV vulvar cancer, including those who will receive any combination of the following interventions: radical vulvectomy or radical local excision with concurrent unilateral or bilateral inguinal or inguinal-femoral lymphadenectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone a therapeutic paracentesis within 4 weeks of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient undergo or has the patient undergone definitive surgery for primary stage I-IV vulvar cancer, including those who will receive or have received any combination of the following interventions: radical vulvectomy or radical local excision with concurrent unilateral or bilateral inguinal or inguinal-femoral lymphadenectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will the patient undergo or has the patient undergone definitive surgery for primary stage I-IV vulvar cancer, including those who will receive any combination of the following interventions: radical vulvectomy or radical local excision with concurrent unilateral or bilateral inguinal or inguinal-femoral lymphadenectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have histological documentation of primary adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have squamous cell histology?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically proven diagnosis of meningioma (WHO grade II) by central pathology review prior to step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient being enrolled within 6 months of initial disease presentation OR within 6 months of refractory disease, disease progression, disease recurrence, second or secondary malignancy, or post-mortem?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must have histological documentation of primary adenocarcinoma of the pancreas. Other pathologies consistent with, but not diagnostic of, adenocarcinoma are acceptable if other clinical parameters indicate pancreatic cancer, such that the patient would be taken to surgery for resection of presumed pancreatic cancer.

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
